remarks: The domain of definition of the internal direct product, which states that ` S ` is a family of subgroups that mutually commute and have trivial intersections.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.) Obsolete version of ~ dprdval as of 11-Jul-2019.  Proof adapted to use the new definition ~ df-dprd .  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
